page.title: 10HOUSING IN MIDDLETON
page.content: Before assimilation into Rochdale, Middleton undertook an extensive building programme. Council estates at Hollin, Moorclose, Boarshaw, Cheapside, Rhodes and Middleton Junction were planned as complete units with houses, flats, bungalows, shopping areas, schools, churches etc. A Manchester overspill estate was built on Langley where high rise flats were constructed despite considerable local opposition. Also on Langley are maisonettes and flats above shopping areas which are now being demolished in favour of more traditional housing. Private developments have taken place on fringe areas ;Alkrington being the largest area.Much new building has taken place in Higher Boarshaw whilst much older cottage property still exists in Birch and Bowlee.
